definition: Monkey Wreaks Havoc in Heaven, story about the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] from the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
day/sky/heaven
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
surname Gong

sentences.english: Oh, it's a reserved opera named "The Monkey Creates Havoc in Heaven".
sentences.chinese: 哦，那是一场保留剧目，名叫“大闹天宫”。

sentences.english: He is Sun Wukong, the Great Sage Equaling Heaven, who made havoc in Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 就是那大闹天宫的齐天大圣孙悟空。

sentences.english: After the havoc in heaven monkey king is captured and sealed in a magic furnace.
sentences.chinese: 大闹天宫后，孙悟空遭擒拿被打入八卦炉冶炼。

sentences.english: The scene design of The Monkey King contains the richness of national culture.
sentences.chinese: 《大闹天宫》的场景设计蕴涵着民族文化的丰富性。

sentences.english: "Making havoc in Heaven" is a typical military play.
sentences.chinese: 《大闹天宫》是一部典型的武戏。

sentences.english: Jo would whistle and made a great racket getting ready.
sentences.chinese: 裘口哨吹得呼呼响，正在大闹天宫似地作准备。

definition: Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]/Son Goku, the main character in Dragon Ball 七龍珠|七龙珠[Qi1 long2 zhu1]
Journey to the West, Ming dynasty novel by Wu Cheng'en 吳承恩|吴承恩, one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature/also called Pilgrimage to the West or Monkey
Great Sage the Equal of Heaven, self-proclaimed title of the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
Great-Sage Sun/Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1]
Zhu Bajie, character in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记, with pig-like characteristics and armed with a muckrake/Pigsy in Arthur Waley's translation
Erlangshen, Chinese deity
Mount Huaguo in Jiangsu, featured in 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4], tourist destination/(also the name of mountains in other parts of China)
Gyuumao
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers from the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 You2 Ji4]
the Jade Emperor
Xuanzang (602-664) Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator, who traveled to India 629-645
Jade Emperor
Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1], the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
Wu Cheng'en (1500-1582), author (or compiler) of novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记
Sha Wujing
Tripitaka (602-664), Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator who traveled to India 629-645/same as 玄奘
